page.title: 17A Child's Day at School.
page.content: I and my sister walk the mile to school,taking a short cut through the new estate. We arrive at 8.50 a.m. and meet our friends in the playground. After registration at 9.00 a.m. each class enters the hall for an assembly. We usually spend the morning doing mathematics work, which may include the four rules of number, fractions, geometry and lots of other topics. We also do English, reading, vocabulary, spelling and written work. The afternoons can be spent on science, geography or history when we sometimes watch a television program. We then may do art, craft, needlework, cooking, music or games. During the afternoon and morning sessions we have a playtime.We can eat a lunch prepared by the kitchen, bring a packed lunch or go home.At 3.30 p.m. I return home on the bus.
